result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Zachary Rodefer

defendant.name: Rodefer, Nicholas Zachary
defendant.address: N9193 Elm St, East Troy, WI 53120

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas Zachary Rodefer in court, in custody.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Nicholas Zachary Rodefer.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have come to an agreement. Defendant plead guilty to Counts # 1. Upon motion of the State Counts #2, #3, are dismissed and read-in. Court GRANTS motion. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291. 
Court orders bond to be REVOKED.
PSI ordered
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.

Defendant Nicholas Zachary Rodefer in court.  Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Nicholas Zachary Rodefer. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Nicholas Zachary Rodefer appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin James Sempf in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Nicholas Zachary Rodefer. 
Attorney Uzowulu was unable to review the Waiver with the defendant and is requesting wavier hearing be set for Thursday on the 1:15PM call.
No objection by the State.

BOND TO COVER 22GF829, 22CF422, 21CF680, 21CF639, & 21CF449

IF BOND IS POSTED, DEFENDANT MUST GO TO THE TREATMENT FACILITY THAT HE INFORMED THE COURT HE WISHES TO GO TO IMPATIENT AT. IF HE LEAVES SAID FACILITY BEFORE SUCCESSFUL DISCHARGE, HE MUST IMMEDIATELY RETURN FOR A BAIL/BOND HEARING.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
